intro: Olearia lyallii, commonly known as the Lyall’s daisy, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, bushy growth habit. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in a spherical shape, which bloom in spring. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Olearia lyallii is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, thriving in well-drained soils.
